alert.note: Alert for Mecklenburg (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 5:10PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of piedmont North Carolina and upstate South Carolina, including the following counties, in piedmont North Carolina, Mecklenburg. In upstate South Carolina, York. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 505 PM EDT, Runoff from earlier heavy rainfall is causing minor flooding along Steele Creek at Carowinds Boulevard. - At 8.5 feet, Steele Creek is likely flooding parts of Pleasant Road near Steele Creek Road. If Steele Creek rises to 9.3 feet, Pleasant Road near Steele Creek Road in York County Will Flood. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southwest Charlotte and Carowinds. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
